title: 113_s2005
content: The Act may be cited as the "CLEAR Cost Information Act of 2013" and requires reporting of certain hospital payment data. The Social Security Act is being amended to include changes in subsection (a)(1) related to hospital payment data reporting requirements. The Social Security Act is being amended to include changes in hospital payment data reporting requirements, including the redesignation of subparagraphs and the addition of a new subparagraph for subsection (d) hospitals. The Social Security Act is being amended to include changes in hospital payment data reporting requirements for subsection (d) hospitals, which must now report payment data to the Secretary in accordance with subsection (l). Subsection (d) hospitals are required to submit data on amounts collected from uninsured and insured patients over the past 2 years. The hospital must report actual amounts collected from uninsured and insured patients for the 50 most common diagnosis-related and ambulatory payment groups over the past 2 years to the Secretary for transparency. The hospital must report data transparently to the general public, with information on hospital collections and policies by zip code being publicly available on a searchable website. The hospital must report data transparently to the general public, with information on hospital collections and policies by zip code being publicly available on a searchable website. The amendments made by this section require subsection (d) hospitals to provide easily comparable data on collections and include a link to this data on their website. Effective for contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of this Act. The Act mandates that MedPAC's annual reports to Congress include data on the percentage of charity care provided by hospitals. Additionally, a report on charity care trends from certain hospitals must be made publicly available. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act mandates the public posting of data on charity care provided by hospitals, allowing for comparisons by zip code on a searchable website. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act requires hospitals to provide easily understandable data on charity care by zip code on their website. Additionally, hospitals must include a link to this data on their homepage as per Medicare requirements. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act mandates hospitals to display charity care data by zip code on their website, with a link on the homepage as required by Medicare for hospitals and critical access hospitals. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act requires hospitals to display charity care data by zip code on their website, with a link on the homepage as mandated by Medicare. The amendments made by paragraph (1) apply to contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of this Act.
